intro: Ranunculus bullatus var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features delicate, bright yellow flowers with finely divided, palmate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and natural habitats.
